description.narrative: Schools, nutrition and health facilities, and child care centers provide adequate WASH services in 15 target districts by 2017,which contributes to Sanitation, Wash In Schools And Ecd Centres, Water. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: At least 85% of women and children access improved water supply facilities and 60% of households use improved sanitation and hygiene services, with a focus on vulnerable and disadvantaged communities, by end of 2016

sector.narrative: Sanitation and hygiene - institutions (schools, health care facilities, ECD centres) including menstrual hygiene management

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Schools, nutrition and health facilities, and child care centers provide adequate WASH services in 15 target districts by 2017

description.narrative: In targeted districts, schools, health facilities and community-based child care Centres had sustainable access to safe drinking water, sanitation and hygiene facilities and services, which facilitated the adoption of good hygiene practices among children and their families . | Status:Met | As-of Date:17/12/2018
